meanings.definition: A pleasing view, especially one seen through a long, narrow opening.
meanings.sent1: The hikers reached the mountaintop and were greeted by breathtaking vistas of the valley below.
meanings.sent2: She loved to sit by the window and gaze at the beautiful vistas of the countryside.
meanings.sent3: The cat climbed the tree for a better vista of the garden, planning its next mischief.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the city skyline transformed into a shimmering vista of lights.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a vivid vista of a serene lake surrounded by lush greenery.

meanings.sent1: His mind was filled with dark vistas of what could go wrong in the future.
meanings.sent2: She had a clear vista of her goals and worked diligently to achieve them.
meanings.sent3: In his dreams, he explored strange vistas of alien worlds and fantastical creatures.
meanings.sent4: The novel opened up new vistas of imagination for the young readers.
meanings.sent5: The therapist helped her navigate the confusing vistas of her own emotions.
